title: Particle diagram of mixture at equilibrium

content.description: The particle diagram shown represents a mixture of <math alttext="N O 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>NO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="N 2 O 4" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math> at equilibrium according to the reaction <math alttext="2 N O 2, gas, is in equilibrium with N 2 O 4, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mi>NO</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>â‡„</mo> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math>.
content.question: Which of the following is the value of <math alttext="K sub p" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>p</mi></msub></math> for the reaction? (Assume that each particle represents a partial pressure of <math alttext="1.0 atmosphere" overflow="scroll"> <mn>1.0</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>atm</mtext> </math> for that substance.)

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
